alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Eastern Orleans; Lower St. Bernard; Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern St. Bernard, north central St. Charles, Orleans, southeastern St. Tammany, northwestern Jefferson, northwestern Plaquemines Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and southwestern Hancock Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1114 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Slidell to near Metairie. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Slidell, Chalmette, Metairie, Harvey, East New Orleans, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Marrero, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Lake Catherine, Poydras, River Ridge, Elmwood, Violet, Terrytown and Meraux. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 218 and 271. Interstate 12 between mile markers 78 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana near mile marker 1. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.
